message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and examination findings suggest carpal tunnel syndrome. Volar splinting can help alleviate the symptoms by immobilizing the wrist in a neutral position. Physiotherapy can be helpful but is not the most appropriate next step. Azathioprine therapy and vitamin B6 supplementation would not be indicated in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and examination findings suggest carpal tunnel syndrome, which can be managed conservatively with volar splinting. Physiotherapy can also be helpful, but the most appropriate initial step is splinting. Azathioprine therapy is not indicated for carpal tunnel syndrome, and there is no evidence to support vitamin B6 supplementation for this condition.

The most appropriate next step in management would be volar splinting to immobilize the affected wrist and relieve symptoms. Physiotherapy and vitamin B6 supplementation may also be helpful, but volar splinting is the most appropriate initial treatment. Azathioprine therapy is not indicated for carpal tunnel syndrome.
